reviews.text: Hi There
reviews.title: Very nice
Great Location
reviews.text: Just came back from a week at the Shinagawa Prince Hotel in Tokyo, Japan. Actually it is a pretty good hotel. Staff were very efficient and friendly. NOTE: Make sure you ask for non-smoking room if you don't smoke. Otherwise you will drown in the stale cigarette smell. The upgraded rooms on the 28th floor were lovely. Very clean, lovely comfortable beds and fluffy doonas etc. Most Japan hotel rooms are small, and the Prince is no different. However still very very comfortable. The hotel is so easily accessible to the JR and subway line it is fantastic! Even if you have never been to Japan before, it is very easy to use. And located just across the street from the hotel. Would stay at the Shinagawa Prince Hotel again.

We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel was in a fantastic location being directly accross from the train / subway station. There were many, many restaurants to choose from in the area, that were lower priced than those located in the actual hotel complex. The breakfasts that were included in my booking, were better at the restaurant in the lobby of the main tower, although the lineups were long on the weekend. There is lots to see and do at this hotel, if you don't mind the price that may come with it. The staff at the guest relations counter were very helpful. The rooms were nice and roomy enough to get by...and well worth the money.
reviews.title: Deceptive reservation practices

reviews.text: As for Tokyo itself...just another busy, big city...and very, very expensive. The people were always very nice and very helpful, even thought it was very hard to find anyway who spoke more than a few words of english. The best time we had was in Kamakura. We took a walking tour of the temples, shrines and other sights in the Kamakura area. This was far more enjoyable than Tokyo itself. It was accesable by the JR train line for about $20 for the round trip.
reviews.title: Very, very convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a reservation for 3 people via hotels.com.
reviews.title: Your experience will vary based on the tower you stay in.

likes.disliked: — Getting stuck in the North Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Shinagawa Prince Hotel 9th Feb, 2008 to 17th Feb, 2008. This was our second stay a the Prince and we couldn't have been happier with our stay. This hotel really is above and beyond what we could hope for. It's so convinenient to reach the train station, the elevators are fairly fast and there are a lot of them, and the staff is friendly and very helpful. For some reason...we have no idea how it happened...we were put in an upgraded room. We stayed on the 30th floor this time. The room was the same size as our previous room, but had updated decor and feather pillows/blankets. It also had an area to hook up to internet and a widescreen HiDef T.V. We will definately be back to this hotel on our future Tokyo trips!!!
reviews.title: Great again!

likes.liked: — It's so convieniently located near the train station
likes.disliked: — The beds are a little on the hard side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the main tower for a 2 night stopover in Tokyo.
reviews.title: Clean, helpful hotel

likes.liked: — The service and the view from our room
likes.disliked: — It's easy to get lost in the hotel complex!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Clean with nice views of Tokyo. Not very large, but big enough to fairly easily move around. Bathroom also quite small but has everything you need, including a crazy electronic Japanese toilet.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient and very helpful staff

reviews.text: Location: Located in the quieter Shinagawa area. However, subway station is a 2min walk from the hotel and Shinagawa is on the Circle line which connects with all of the main areas in Tokyo.
reviews.title: Humungous hotel, great location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Staff spoke English and were happy to store luggage with a very organised service that included booking our return shuttle to Narita airport. Very helpful like most people you meet in Tokyo.
reviews.title: Satisfactory for a 2 night stopover

likes.liked: — Good price, excellent value for money in an expensive city.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Prince hotel Main Tower from April 3rd through april 10th. The room I stayed in was a updated room and it was amazing. Of course in Japan it was smaller then normal rooms but the way its set up makes it seem bigger. I would recommend getting a room on a higher floor because those are the more updated rooms. I also got the breakfest add on to the room each day. I tried almost all the choices that they had available. The one I would recommend most is the buffet in the main tower next to lobby forgot what its called. The hotel has so much you can do. I didnt get to do all of it but I did go bowling and after getting in for the night I did some kareoke. Bowling was fun I went during the evening when all the business people were there and they are fun to watch. Kareoke is HUGE in Japan and the hotel had its own. You pay for the time you want and get your own room that fits like 10 people. Me and a friend got a room for about two hours and you can stop a song if you get bored and pick a new one and they can also bring you drinks. The staff is so nice they also said hi when you walk by and if you need help with something and even though they try to understand you they go out of there way to find someone or walk you to where you need to go. Also like everyone else said very convinent to the JR station.
reviews.title: Way better then I would of ever thought

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hapuna Restaurant reservation and services were the worst I have had in all of Tokyo during my past 8-years living in Japan. Foreign tourists should avoid this hotel and its restaurants like the plague. Reservations are impossible to make (they frequently tell phone customers no reservations can be taken, just show up and wait at the door like everyone else); long waiting at Hapuna door on Waiting List; Maitre-D is rude towards foreigners; Waitress Service is extremely poor or non-existant; Food quality at Buffet Restaurant is very poor (hot food is always luke/cold, empty serving plates, etc.); Restaurant prices are hugely overpriced and not worth the very high-price. The Prince Hotel chain has become so arrogant that they feel no embarrassment by treating everyone badly. I left the hotel and restaurant feeling cheated; as if I had wasted my money. If you want Buffet/Viking Restaurant, it would be better to choose the Le Meridian across the street; Yokohama Sheraton; Sakuragicho Intercontinental Hotel; etc. All of these are much better overall than this terrible Hapuna.
reviews.title: Worst Restaurant Service in Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Annex in nonsmoking.
reviews.title: Good soundproofing, air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hoped to use the NEX directly from NRT to Shinagawa for an overnight to recover from jetlag before heading on to Kyoto. Unfortunately, there had been an accident and the NEX was not running, so we used the other train with a transfer to get to the hotel--not as convenient, but cheaper, and still got us to within 1 block of hotel.
reviews.title: Super convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't sure how to get to the actual hotel once on the street--we could see the high rises, but there is multistory retail in front. We later found out we could have walked up through the retail (past the McD's) up ramps to the elevator that leads to the 7th floor lobby of the Annex. Easy return to train station next day.
reviews.title: Great place, great location, great fun!

reviews.text: Hotel had a small shopping area and convenience store- actually that was in the "Annex" part of the hotel which was adjoined by a hallway thru the Main Tower. The location was great, 5 min walk to Shinagawa Station. Plenty of eateries
